programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: A sea lion called Finn has tummy trouble and the team feeds him a snack that will help them investigate why; Big Mama, the guitarfish, may be living up to her name; the boa-duo, Ripley and Ridley, receive a new home.

programme.title: Wild Frank
programme.desc: Frank contacts the first Brazilian tribe, the Satere Mawe, and faces one of the most painful rites to be accepted as one of them.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest teams up with a specialist in Newfoundland in search of a predator that was declared extinct in 1930; the duo meets with a hunter that shot what is believed to be a wolf and uncovers evidence that suggests the species could be alive.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest travels to the Faroe Islands to look for any trace of the great auk; his passionate search for a large flightless seabird takes him through some of the most scenic and rugged terrain hes ever seen.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Madagascars Pachylemurs were red, furry giants, nearly the size of great apes; recently discovered remains disprove that they went extinct 1,000 years ago; Forrest tries to prove the giant species still lives.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: A cow called Buttercup comes to Barn Sanctuary, but the team is concerned about her feisty behavior toward the rest of the herd; Ginger the lamb battles a life-threatening infection, and Bart the rowdy rooster is in need of a vet visit.

programme.title: Rugged Justice
programme.desc: Hunter kills elk illegally, suspicious activity in the desert, bear tears apart the inside of a car, and the FWP track down a suspect with three warrants to his name.

programme.title: Blood Ivory
programme.desc: The VETPAW team scrambles through red tape while realizing the majesty of Africa and what they came there for; for their first operation, their search for ivory takes them to a remote village belonging to a tribe known to use poisonous arrows.

programme.title: Walking with Elephants
programme.desc: Levison Wood is in Botswana hoping to follow the worlds largest elephant migration for 650 miles on foot along ancient pathways, but he first must overcome dangers in the bush before tracking a large herd of female elephants.
